com.cisco.dvbu.ps.deploytool.gui.resources

Class ExecuteResource

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cisco.dvbu.ps.deploytool.gui.resources.ExecuteResource

  • public class ExecuteResource
extends java.lang.Object

    Servlet for executing PDTool deployment plans.

    Ideally, a PDTool execution would be performed synchronously and the output streamed back to the browser client. At this point, streaming communications between browser and server are not well defined by the W3C so the idea here is to make an asynchronous call to execute a PDTool plan, then pass back the launch results to the browser. The browser will then use the log servlet (see LogResource) to poll periodically to get log messages until the execution is complete (effectively "tail"ing the log file.)

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Calvin Goodrich

    • Method Detail

      • executePDTool

        public ExecuteResult executePDTool(java.lang.String planPath,
                          java.lang.String confPath,
                          @Context
                          javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req)

        Executes a deployment plan.

        Parameters:
        planPath - The URL encoded path to look for.
        confPath - An integer indicating what file type is being used.
        req - Servlet request object containing client request parameters.
        Returns:
        An ExecuteResult object. Indicates success (0) or failure (1) to launch ExecutePDTool.
